text: Below there are several questions. To answer them, drag each tile by its 6 dots into your workspace. Once in your workspace, the tiles will become editable.

<Title: Analyze Kenia’s Model>

1. In your group, make sense of and discuss Kenia’s Model. Is this model useful enough to help her make her decision? State your reasons to support your answer.

<Title: Revise Kenia’s Model>

2. List other variables (as many as possible) that you believe Kenia should consider.

In the diagram tile, you will use these new factors/variables to build on Kenia’s model to develop a more comprehensive model.

<Title: Revise Kenia’s Model>

3. List other assumptions (as many as possible) that you believe Kenia should consider.

<Title: Build Model>

4. Build your model in the diagram tile below. Keep track of any changes that you make to your variables and assumptions.

<Title: Generalization>

5. Describe what would be true about all of the problems that Kenia could use your model to solve as the model is now.

Describe at least one problem that Kenia cannot solve using your model as it is now but which seems similar to the problems that Kenia can solve with your model.

How would you adjust your model to make it work for this additional problem?

<Title: Test Model>

6. Worcester, Marlborough, and Chelmsford are other popular places where people live in Boston, Massachusetts. Gather data about these three places and use your model, including the variables and assumptions, to determine if they are places Kenia could live in.

Describe what you did to test your model.

What are your test results for these three places?

What do these results mean in terms of where Kenia should live?

<Title: Model Report>

7. Write a report about your model by writing a letter to your client:

  • Describing how you have improved Kenia’s model.
  • Describing how you have tested your model.
  • Describing the strengths and weaknesses of your model
  • Advising your client and anyone on how to use your model.

Dear Kenia,

Sincerely,

(Name of group members)

<Summary and Recap>

8. As you worked on the final project, you (a) analyzed, (b) revised a model, (c) generalized a model, (d) tested a model, and (e) wrote a model report. In your words, what does it mean:

  • to analyze a model?

  • to revise a model?

  • to generalize a model?

  • to test a model?

  • to report a model?

<References>

List all the references you used here:

1. Average Utility Costs by State Breakdown – Forbes Home

2. Average Rental Price in Cambridge, MA & Market Trends | Zillow Rental Manager
